Platform

Platform class

exported from ionic/ionic

## Members

is(platformName)

Param Type Details
platformName string
  • Returns:
    bool import {Platform} 'ionic/ionic'; export MyClass { constructor(platform: Platform){ this.platform = platform; if(this.platform.is('ios'){ // what ever you need to do for // if the platfomr is ios } } }

platforms()

Depending on what device you are on, platforms can return multiple values.
Each possible value is a hierarchy of platforms. For example, on an iPhone,
it would return mobile, ios, and iphone.

import {Platform} 'ionic/ionic';
export MyClass {
   constructor(platform: Platform){
     this.platform = platform;
     console.log(this.platform.platforms());
     // This will return an array of all the availble platforms
     // From if your on mobile, to mobile os, and device name
   }
}
  • Returns:
    array the array of platforms

versions(platformName)

TODO
Returns an object containing the os version

import {Platform} 'ionic/ionic';
export MyClass {
   constructor(platform: Platform){
     this.platform = platform;
     console.log(this.platform.versions('android'));
     // Returns an object with the os version as a string,
     // The Major version as a string
     // The Minor version as a string
   }
}
Param Type Details
platformName string
  • Returns:
    object

ready()

TODO
Returns a promise when the platform is ready and native functionality can be called

import {Platform} 'ionic/ionic';
export MyClass {
   constructor(platform: Platform){
     this.platform = platform;
     this.platform.ready().then(() => {
       console.log('Platform ready');
       // The platform is now ready, execute any native code you want
      });
   }
}
  • Returns:
    promise
